LSystemComposite Class Reference

#include <LSystemComposite.h>

Inheritance diagram for LSystemComposite:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class roughly follows the composite pattern (as in the Design Patterns Composite), and provides a way to manage an aggregate of lsystems in a recursive fashion.

It also provides some management methods that operate on groups of LSystems (like getIds)

bool LSystemComposite::getLSystemInterface (  LSystemInterface &  lSystem,
string  id,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

gets a copy of an LSystemInterface object with id.

Note that an LSystemInterface just sends commands to an LSystemServer, so you are really just grabbing a remote wrapper to the object. (that's why it's not a pointer)

Parameters:
id the id of the LSystemInterface you want a copy of
a copy of the LSystemInterface with the given id

bool LSystemComposite::initFromServer (  string  serverIp,
int  port,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Initializes this object from the LSystems currently residing on an LSystem server.

If an LSystem on the server has the same id as an lSystem currently contained in this object, then the original system will be kept (not the one on the server). And a warning will be logged.

Parameters:
serverIp the ip of the server
port the port of the server

void LSystemComposite::setNotify (  bool  notify,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Returns (via a reference parameter) a pointer at the logger object for this class Note: this method delets logger if it's passed value is non-NULL.

This means your program may (and hopefully will!) seg fault if you pass a non-initialized, non-null pointer

Parameters:
logger a pointer at the logger object of this class

Reimplemented from CommonAspect.
